intro: Trichanthecium gracilicaule, commonly known as the slender-stemmed trichanthecium, is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It is a herbaceous plant with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of South America and thrives in dry, open habitats. Due to its delicate structure and ornamental potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
